text:
I use Cgywin to log into the Linux server running Tomcat.  I stop Tomcat
(bin/shutdown.sh).  Then I start it up (bin/startup.sh).  I open up Firefox on
the same Linux machine and the web applications running on Tomcat load up fine.
 Then I close all windows and log out of Linux.  Finally I close Cgywin to shut
down the remote connection.  I open up a new browser on my Windows machine and
try to load the web application again.  Tomcat crashes!  Says "Service Unavailable".

In catalina.out the last line is: "X connection to xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx:0.0 host
broken (explicit kill or server shutdown)".  Nothing else is logged after this
because tomcat is no longer running.

This occured when we upgraded from 5.5.20 to 5.5.23.  We had to rollback to
5.5.20 due to these Tomcat crashes.

RedHat Linux
Apache
Tomcat Connector (JK 1.2)
JRE 5.0
creator: Jimmy.Winn@gmail.com

text:
I would INVALID this one.

(a) this has nothing to do with cygwin - it's just an issue with logging in
remotely and starting tomcat. (b) read about "nohup".

Thanks for your comment.  I read up on "nohup" which I will try to see if it
works.  Well, to clarify the problem further it is slightly random.  Sometimes
when I log out, Tomcat will still run, but portions of the site becomes buggy. 
We create images on the fly and they fail to load properly.  The problem has
something to do with the jars initially loaded not working anymore.  Sometimes
Tomcat, however, crashes completely.  Not sure exactly what is going on.
I don't see any Tomcat issues here.

text:
You have to unset your DISPLAY -var before starting tomcat remotely!
Otherwise the awt-toolkit will try to use your your remote x-server.
